bibl.title: Letter from A. Diaz Albertini to Philip Showalter Hench, August 9, 1941

div1.p: Albertini identifies men in the photograph which Hench sent him. He informs Hench that the book on Military Hospital No. 1 cannot be lent to him, but can be copied.

div1.head: Letter from A. Diaz Albertini to Philip Showalter Hench, August 9, 1941
div1.opener:
Instituto Finlay
-----
Comité Gubernativo
-----
La Habana
-----
August 9, 1941.
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn.
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I take pleasure in acknowledging receipt
of your letter of July 18th, as well as of the Pro-
ceedings of the Staff Meetings of the Mayo Clinic,
arriving here periodically and for which I wish to
thank you.

I wish to acknowledge receipt also of the
photograph which I am returning to you. This pic-
ture was taken forty years ago and seems to be of
interest since prominent physicians already gone are
depictured. From left to right I have been able to
recognize, seating, Drs. Carlos J. Finlay and Juan
Guiteras. Standing up, Drs. Alfredo Dominguez
Roldán, Aristides Agramonte, Taylor, Antonio Diaz
Albertini, (myself) an American visitor whose name
I am not aware of, and Dr. Hugo Roberts, presently
Chief of the Quarantine Department of Cuba.

In regards for the “Memoria del Hospital
Número Uno” by Calliol, 1903, which you saw in
the library at the Finlay Institute, being this
the only available copy we cannot afford to send
it to you, but if you think it advisable, we could
draw photostatic print out of the pages which you
are more interested in, thus enabling you to have
an exact reproduction of such paper.

With every good wish and best personal
regards, I am
